summary: This is an email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the preparation and transfer of a hard drive containing evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses sending replacement drives to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) and coordinating with the defense for a complete reproduction.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist at U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the transfer of evidence drives related to Ghislaine Maxwell's case to the Metropolitan Detention Center and with the defense.

events.title: Evidence Drive Transfer Coordination
events.description: A paralegal specialist emails about a drive being ready for transfer to MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell, attaching cover letters and noting the need to request a padlock drive from the defense for a complete reproduction and to retrieve a broken drive from MDC.

keyFacts: An evidence drive related to Ghislaine Maxwell was prepared for transfer to the Metropolitan Detention Center on December 3, 2020.
The communication indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the defense team regarding evidence reproduction and retrieval.
The email references a 'broken drive' that needs to be retrieved from MDC, suggesting prior evidence handling issues.
